I always kid with him about not being a rebounder, being so big, Allen Iverson said of his fellow All-Star starter. "I say, "If I was your height, I"d get a double-double every night." Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that, "In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped." But he insists that

domineering former US defense secretary- the late Robert McNamara - who came to describe the Vietnam War as "terribly wrong. " "That's not the case with Iraq," Donald Rumsfeld said. I think the world's a better place with[ former Iraqi president] Saddam Hussein gone and with the Taliban gone and the al-Qaeda out of Afghanistan, he said, adding that the President Bush administration"s decision to invade Iraq in the wake of the Sept. 11 attacks on the US was "incremental," not rushed.

If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell , Jane Lynch explains. "You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her. one of the prodigies who co-founded the company behind the Internet's dominant gateway. The surprise shake-up announced Thursday appears to be driven by Eric Schmidt 's desire to tackle other challenges as much as Page's personal ambition. Day-to-day adult That's Eric Schmidt : So long to the Google Inc. chief who wasn't For six years, Larry Page and Sergey Brin told Eric Schmidt that Google Inc. should build its own browser, and for six years, he resisted. " Google Inc. was a small company, Eric Schmidt remembered. "Having come through the bruising browser wars, I didn't want to do that again."
